Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
SDK-19318 - FxScrollBar sometimes doesn't dispatch click event when clicking in track
SDK-19320 - FxSlider doesn't dispatch click events when clicking in track
Neither Slider nor ScrollBar dispatches click events if the mouse down target is different than the mouse up target. This usually occurs if the thumb moves under the mouse after a mouseDown.

The fix is to listen for a mouseDown event and record the target. When we get a mouseUp event, if the mouseUp target is contained in the TrackBase and is not the same target as the mouseDown target, dispatch a click event. If the targets are the same, the Player will dispatch the click event.

There are a couple of differences between a mouse click event that occurs entirely on the track versus one that starts on the track and ends on the thumb. The first event’s target is the track and the event phase is BUBBLING_PHASE. The second event’s target is the TrackBase and the event phase is AT_TARGET.
QE Notes: Add tests for listening for click events on Slider and ScrollBar
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Renaming SkinnableComponent's loadSkin() and unloadSkin() skinning lifecycle methods to createSkin() and destroySkin() as no loading actually occurs here.

Also fixing up a few ASDoc bugs in the videoplayer stuff.  Also, checking in modifications to TrackBase, which was a file I missed yesterday when checking in.  The changes add 3 new events to TrackBase and clean it up so the setters don't do any extra work if it's being set to the same value as it was before.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Added animation behavior to scrollbars and sliders. For now, animation only happens based on mouse events (key events still have previous non-animated behavior).
Also, added shift-click behavior to ScrollBar, behaves essentially like a Slider, going to the clicked location instead of paging toward it.
Finally, fixed an unrelated bug in Animation where Animates set up with a MotionPath with no time=0 keyframe would not run properly.

These changes necessitate changes in Mustella (need to listen to 'change' event on scrollbars/sliders, not 'updateComplete' or 'click', since the animations may cause several valid 'updateComplete' events on the way to the final changed value.
QE Notes: Mustella changes in ScrollBar and Slider necessary. See note above. Changes have been made and are awaiting this checkin to update Mustella tests.
Reviewer: Hans and Glenn (scrolling/sliding changes), Jason (Animation bug changes)
tests: checkintests, Mustella ScrollBar, Slider, Scroller (all required minor changes to pass)
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
1st pass of rename according to the spec http://opensource.adobe.com/wiki/display/flexsdk/Dropping+the+Fx+Prefix

Flex now requires CSS Style declarations to declare @namespace rules and disambiguate between halo and spark components using CSS 3 namespace prefixes on type selectors. At compile time, this namespace information will be used to map type names to qualified ActionScript class names. At runtime, type selectors are matched on qualified ActionScript class name (for example mx.controls.Button rather than just Button). Flex 3 applications must be compiled with -compatibility-version=3.0.0 to get unqualified CSS type selector behavior.
QE: Yes, this build may help in updating test cases to use the new namespaces and class names.
